website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality kickstand that fits most bikes at a price that will fit any budget.
pros: Stiff, so it won't slip down on you as you ride
cons: The heaviness and stiffness of the kickstand may be too much for small children to handle

customer_reviews.title: Good stand but make sure it will work on the bike you have...
customer_reviews.text: Well built, our complaint is for a kids bike if it doesn't have a straight cross-member to bolt to it won't work. We have a Disney Planes Huffy bike (second photo) that it won't bolt to. To show what I mean see the two photos. The Disney Princess bike (first photo) it would work on but not the Huffy Planes bike and we wanted to use for the Planes bike without training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T

customer_reviews.title: It works for both my girls' 16" and 18" bikes
customer_reviews.text: This kick stand works for both my girls' 16" and 18" bikes (see the pics). It feels very heavy, so I would expect it to last for a while. The installation is pretty straight forward. There is only one screw that you'll need to tighten for installation. The kick stand can also be adjusted to fit on different sizes of bikes. For my girl's 16" bike, it is on the third last hole, so I think it should definitely work for 12" and 14" bikes. Overall, I like this kick stand and it's great that my garage is back to be organized again.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn H.

customer_reviews.title: A hard pass
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughters 12 inch bike. Very quick to install. However great the cost, it is not long enough to adequately sustain the height of the bike in any position. I have adjusted it every which way, and unless you hold the bike sturdy for at least five seconds after you put the kickstand down, then it will just fall over. As a note, I built bikes for 2 years and this is fundamentally a bad kickstand. I would definitely pass on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Started out ok, but does not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my son's bike and, once he was ready to take off the training wheels, it installed quite easily. After a brief time, I ordered one for my daughter's bike. Again, it was easy to install. After less than 3 months use, neither of them will hold up the kids' bikes any longer. The construction is so bad that the weight of their 12" and 14" bikes has warped them to the point they will not hold up the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy & well made for the price & easy install!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quick & easy install. My 6yr old was ready for her training wheeks to come off & needed to purchase a kickstand that easy on the wallet & easy to install. I was fortunate that there was already a pre-drilled hole for a kickstand on her bike. So the install took less than 5mins to include opening the package. The height adjustment on the kickstand is clever & very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Shanon Tanuvas-Lole

customer_reviews.title: Worthless hardware....
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. I guess this stand was not ACTUALLY meant to be adjusted. Cheap soft screw immediately stripped after two turns with a properly sized hand screwdriver. Tried to use vice clamp to remove it. Apparently it’s was just driven in badly at the factory!! Worthless. Wanted to surprise my daughter. Apparently now I have to order something else...waste of time... Won’t allow me to post pictures....
customer_reviews.author: FreshmanGREEN

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit common brand 12" bikes,  as it is way too big.
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the description this does not fit a 12 inch bike. I tried it on our 12" Schwinn as well as our 12" Spezialized bike (see photos). The kickstand can be bolted well onto the center frame mount, but it is just way too long, even on the shortest setting it is 10 inch long. I double checked and the package says indeed Bell 100 not the bigger 300 model. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: E.D.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality...but the kickstand is too long for a 20” bike
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 20” BMX. Fits okay, sits a little upright and can fall over easy. Quality is good and should last a long time. Save yourself some time and measure your existing kickstand before purchasing. Don’t go by the sellers description or the bike tire size. I ended up buying one that was adjustable that could be cut to length. For this bike I need a kickstand to be 12 inches long.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Probably would be Ok for an adult bike, too big for a kids bike.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 of these for my kids bikes now that their training wheels have come off. Unfortunately they’re too big for all of them. 2 are 16” bikes and one is a 12”. They’re also difficult to install on the bikes due to the position of the chain cover. Thankfully these weren’t expensive so it’s not worth the hassle to return now, but I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JDS

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more if you can find better
customer_reviews.text: Set screw shipped from the factory torqued too tight, and it's made from soft metal, so the Phillips head nearly stripped trying to get it out to adjust the length. The leg can move around quite a bit and doesn't always spring back to the proper place, sometimes making the stand rub the rear tire spokes, even when the mounting bracket has been attached firmly to the bicycle frame. Considering replacing with something with better manufacturing, if I can find one.
customer_reviews.author: W. Price

customer_reviews.title: High quality kickstand.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughters bike, that came with training wheels. She finally shed the extra wheels, so it was time for a kickstand. This installed very easily, but I could see there being issues depending the the bicycle style/design, but in our case it fit nearly perfectly. It is easily adjustable as well. I think the only issue we have with it, is that it is quite stiff, and doesn't move into, or out of position very easily; she has to hop off of the bike usually to put the stand down. Afaik, there is no way to adjust the stiffness. Other than that, it's a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but works well.
customer_reviews.text: The mounting bracket is strong and works well. The adjustable height sleeve is flimsy and supplies only the minimum necessary support when standing up the bike. But it works and is easy to install using a wrench and phillips screwdriver. The problem when buying a fixed size kickstand is that you never know the exact length to buy. Absent that, I would have to buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: GBustin

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a kids bike.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for a kids bike. Works great on my kids 16 inch bike. Very easy to install. Would buy again. Drops down about 2 inches below the frame and win fully retracted angles down a little bit. Not fully Perpen lo works great on my kids 16 inch bike. Very easy to install. Would buy again. Drops down about 2 inches below the frame and when fully retracted angles down a little bit. Not fully Parallel with bike frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on my grandkids' bikes, they are now without training wheels so they need to have a kickstand to properly care for their new bikes by STANDING them up, and not slamming them down on the pavement. These are adjustable in length so they can be moved to a larger bike if needed/as they grow to a larger bike.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for out little girls 16" bike when we took her training wheels off as it didn't have any other way of staying upright. Super easy ro bolt on and adjust. Plenty of adjustment room left as well. We have it on its next to shortest setting on her bike, but with the amount of adjustment available it would easily fit a much larger bike. And not so stiff that she can't kick it up and down herself.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cook

customer_reviews.title: a little long in the tooth
customer_reviews.text: So it is a little too long for the 16" bike size frame. I was able to remove the outer extendable shell and rubber pad so it could work, but its not great quality. With the spring tension it tends to pull the stand into the bike frame almost rubbing up against the back wheel. Barely works for now.
customer_reviews.author: lionlam

customer_reviews.title: Stand was missing bolt for kickstand.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the bag, all I found was the kickstand and the adjustable shaft. The screw to lock the shaft in place was missing. I called Bell and they said that they don’t carry the screw and to return it. Luckily, I had a screw that fit. Yes, I checked the bag Twice for the screw. This will be my last Bell product that I buy.
customer_reviews.author: akt373

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand is okay. This worked great on our 18" bike, as you can see in the picture. It's only lengthened by one slot though. I don't see how it could fit smaller bikes. Our 16" bike has the same setup as pictured and the kickstand was too long, even on the shortest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Ruff n Ready

customer_reviews.title: Add A Stand!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we have bought these stands for our kids and they both fit up perfect and work great. The adjustable length makes it easy to fit it up to your bike. It amazes me that bike manufacturing firms can get away with selling a bike without a stand. Be sure to oil the point where the metal parts rub on each other. This extends the stand life and your kiddo can operate it a lot easier. I use 3 in 1 oil.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived faulty, very disappointed :-(
customer_reviews.text: I’m very very disappointed in this stand. The screw that you must loosen/tighten to adjust the stand height was completely stripped upon arrival. We tried every way possible to adjust this height on stand, but no matter which screwdriver we used there wasn’t a single one that would grip into the grooves to allow for the adjustment needed. Very disappointing not only for me, but mainly for my excited child who really wanted a good kickstand for her bike.
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: Good adjustable kick stand for my daughter's bike
customer_reviews.text: My daughter transitioned from training wheels, and her bike didn't include a kickstand. This one was easy to install and adjust. This kickstand mounts to the fork behind the pedals, which seems sturdier than many of the other options I saw, which mount on the back axle.
customer_reviews.author: gregsedwards

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it unless you want your bike laying on the ground.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst kick stand ever. Don't buy it unless you want your bike to lay on the ground all the time. Its angle is to steep. The bike just falls whenever there is the slightest bump or not even touched, the bike is almost always falling over or on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Had to drill another hole to drop it just a notch more for a 16inch bicycle. It is very nicely built and installed easily. Loktite thread lock would make sure nothing loosens us. Overall, great stand especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: It's a kickstand.
customer_reviews.text: At first, my kid's bike would always fall over if you let it go. Now, with a kickstand, properly deployed, it doesn't. Gone are the days of, "Oh, how I wish this bike had a kickstand." With this kickstand, the scourge of having to bend over to lift a prone bicycle up is gone. Purchasing this was the best decision I've ever made in my stupid life, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: ivan offelitch

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Effective
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand bolted right up to my nephew's bike when the training wheels came off. Adjusting the leg to the correct length was very simple using the set screw. The rubber knob on the bottom feels substantial and should last a good while. This thing was stiff straight out of the package. I had to put a few drops of oil under the joint and work it back and forth for a minute until it loosened up. It has been fine since and snaps back and forth with minimal effort. The up position sits perfectly parallel to the rear lower frame and does not interfere with pedaling. Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MD90

customer_reviews.title: Missing set screw. Resolved
customer_reviews.text: Waited days to get the kickstand only to open the package and find that the set screw and washer were not included. They had to know it was missing when they packaged it, just a waste of time and shipping! Update. I initiated a return and a new kickstand was sent to me and it got here a quickly. The stand is good and works nicely for my kids 16" bike.
customer_reviews.author: breeze

customer_reviews.title: Fitted perfectly !!! Sturdy !! Easy for a 5 y.old to make it stand !
customer_reviews.text: It was the exact size we needed for our daughters bike,it's sturdy and holds very well.We ride the bike a lot every single week and she can easily put it up or down by herself with her tiny foot.She doesn't need extra help.Happy with the purchase !!
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Maier

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. I like the concept
customer_reviews.text: Essy to install and set for the right height but feels a little flimsy and the screw fell out once (from the adjustment area). Good thing I saw it happen and was able to fix it and tighten this screw. I like that its adjustable. Dont like that it feels flimsy
customer_reviews.author: TaniaH

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my son's bike
customer_reviews.text: My son's bike did not have a kickstand and I was able to install this item to his bike with no issues. It took a bit of time to attach it his bike due to the screw thread but was able to get it done. The reasons for the three stars are: 1) the kickstand requires a little effort to retract. 2) the rubber piece on the kickstand fell off once however I was able to locate it and reattach it.
customer_reviews.author: Lenjai

customer_reviews.title: I have never had a bad experience with any Bell products and I expect no ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kick stand for my daughter's 16" bicycle. It's universal mounting hardware allowed me to install it in minutes, painlessly. The post itself is adjustable so this will work on many different sizes of bike. So far the stand seems to hold the bike up well and it stays up secure when raised. The last thing you want is the leg coming down when you are riding! I have never had a bad experience with any Bell products and I expect no different from this kick stand. The silver finish looks nice and should compliment most bikes.
customer_reviews.author: James G

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand is not a safe option if you have small children. We installed this on a bike and the bike would not stand up properly. It kept falling over and I was worried one of the kids would get smashed by the falling bike.
customer_reviews.author: HometoU

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. I ordered one, thought it was broken or something, ordered another. It was better than the first, but still not right. The spring pulls the kick stand so the bolt starts to be loose and crooked. Get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: CY

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t angle out far enough to properly brace the bike. My daughter’s bike is constantly tipping over in the garage. Looks ok from the side, but when viewed in line you can see it points pretty much straight down.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Screws overtightened
customer_reviews.text: The design of this is fine, but the screw to adjust the height is overtightened, so I stripped the screw trying to loosen it. $6... so not worth the effort of returning. Just beware.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, spring is way to stiff for little kids to move.
customer_reviews.text: Fits Flawlessly on my son's 16 inch bike. I like how the kickstand is adjustable so I can use on his next bike. Only problem is that the spring is stiff, too stiff. My son, 5 years old, can't kick it down or up. I have to help him move the kick stand. My wife even had problems with it. It did begin to loosen up so he can now kick it up. But still can't kick it down. The stiffness defeats the purpose that the kickstand can become so little for toddler bikes. If a kid can't use it, why make it go so small. I myself wouldn't want a kick stand this stiff on my mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: LordMaul

customer_reviews.title: Basic, not Universal
customer_reviews.text: Bulky and obtrusive. The screw to adjust height is flimsy and could strip easily. Does r fit all kids bike applications. In my pictures, it fits the red bike with the traditional design but is not long enough for the blue bike that has rear suspension.
customer_reviews.author: JBC

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I hope I am contacted about this. And can update my review. The kickstand was easy to install but the adjustment screw would not come out. The screw is soft metal and striped while I was trying to hand unscrew it. It is useless as it is to short without being adjusted, which I can not do now to the screw being striped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cracked stopper doesn't stay on
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but then we noticed that the black stopper at bottom is cracked so it keeps flying off. Couldn't contact seller for replacement piece and seems like too much trouble to uninstall and return. Would really like just a replacement stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Boudreau

customer_reviews.title: Good but will wear out over time
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 16-in bike it serves the purpose but after a few months it's starting to get kind of loose and I'm not able to tighten it up because the bolt that holds the kickstand on has gotten worn out and won't allow the bike to stand up at the angle it makes it stand straight up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too long for a 16" bike
customer_reviews.text: Like others have found this wasn't anywhere near the right size for a 16" bike. It was about 1.5" too long. No way it would work for 12" as advertised. I made it work by cutting it down by about 2", and drilling and tapping a new hole for the adjustment screw.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Rees

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my daughters 16” bike. It went on easily. She often takes her bike to a park or school to ride with friends. They often leave their bike to run off and play. It’s nice not having a pile of kids bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Hello Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Spend $5 more, get something better.
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough but the screw used to adjust the height of the kickstand was screwed in unbelievably tightly. Additionally, the screw stripped almost immediately using only manual strength. Not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: CA - Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: It works.  16" bike.  Discrete length settings secures the adjustable portion more solidly.
customer_reviews.text: It works! I bought 2 kickstands previous to this one and neither worked - too wobly, screw loose in 1 day, not enought angle, not long enought, etc. This one feels solid. Definitely works for 16" bike - on the 3rd of 10 length settings, so would probably work for 14" bike and definitely work for larger bikes. The adjustable telescoping rod is secured by putting the screw through discrete holes in the inner/telescoping rod, rather than by simply putting pressure on the rod.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: adjustment screw soft steel
customer_reviews.text: Broke down after ~10 uses. Soft metal rivet was expected to hold this together. The adjustment screw is made from a rather soft metal and the drive was stripped when I tried loosening it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Poorly machined junk
customer_reviews.text: It is so poorly machined it will not work with a 12" bike. The angle of the stand is so loose that the spring pulls it nearly vertical with the bike stuck that the bike is standing straight up with no angle and falls over.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.P

customer_reviews.title: Works but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust and install but the tolerance is too loose in the way it engages. Bike wants to fall over unless you take your time and pull the kickstand out manually. I'd look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: B. Freese

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand is mounted to the base plate by a single rivet. After about 1 hour the rivet became so loose the stand would not work. I drilled out the rivet and replaced it with a nut and bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 16” kids bike
customer_reviews.text: I almost got the other Bell stand but kept reading that it was too long for a kids bike. This one was perfect. I wouldn’t recommend it for anything smaller than a 16.
customer_reviews.author: Rainy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Kickstand came exactly as described. It was super easy to install. Only took about 5 minutes. I love that that stand is adjustable to different heights. As people have mentioned, just make sure your bike has the hole for the bolt to go through and you're golden.
customer_reviews.author: photomom17

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit riprock specialized 16” bike
customer_reviews.text: For those considering this for their 16 inch specialized rip rock - it is too long; there is a plate at the bolt that doesn’t fit right and doesn’t let the plate sit flush - thereby making the whole stand too long; I ended up hacking off the stand and making it shorter; the stand is solid steel so it took a bit more sweat than I expected; also the spring is too stiff for our 5 yr old, even though he’s strong enough to ride without training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: bostonchap

customer_reviews.title: Not for 16in Specialized Riprock
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this kickstand, it just didn't work on my daughter's 16 inch Specialized Riprock. It's at least 2 inches too long. It seems like great quality for the price though and Amazon was great about the return process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Height adjustment screw sticks
customer_reviews.text: Basic install to bike. Not so easy to adjust height. The adjustment screw was either locked in improperly (i.e. not aligned with the threads). Would not unscrew. Striped screw head. Works but not at the optimum angle. Nor worth returning.
customer_reviews.author: Carl A. Tomasi

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: When i first put this on I did not have it set right and the bike would fall over. I readjusted it and it works perfectly. My son no longer needed his training wheels and loves having the kickstand
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: After taking the training wheels off, this kickstand is a must. Just put it on and had my lil girl try it out. Works perfect. Adjusted to correct size for 20" bike, of course. See pic.
customer_reviews.author: Smart one

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit 16” specialized bike
customer_reviews.text: Too long for my sons 16” specialized bike even with the adjustable portion removed. It did work on a 20” trek tag along so will keep it as it is sturdy enough, but disappointed it doesn’t fit as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Connor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and looks good
customer_reviews.text: This took less than a minute to install. It looks good and seems to work well. I didn’t need to adjust the length for a 16inch bike. Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: YipperSkipper

customer_reviews.title: Working Well on Daughter's 18" Bike
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, who can ride without training wheels but is small for her age, received an 18" bike with training wheels for her 8th birthday. (Apparently all bikes in this size range and under have training wheels?) Since we immediately took off the training wheels and didn't want the bike just laying on the garage floor, we purchased this kickstand for it. The kickstand was easy to install and works great. Why don't they include a kickstand with training-wheeled bikes? Isn't the point to eventually take off the training wheels, in which case you'd then need a kickstand?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Works well; adjustability is very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my 8-year-old daughter's Barbie bike with 18-inch wheels. It's stable and holds the bike very well. The mechanism was very stiff and difficult to deploy. But a squirt of WD-40 or silicone lubricant makes it very manageable. The adjustable height feature makes it easy to find a setting that works well with a particular bike's height. It does seem possible that the adjustment screw could loosen and fall out with use. I put a dab ofon it when I installed it. It's been a month and it's still tight. I'll update the review if the screw proves to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless and good for nothing
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t extend long enough to actually use it to stand up the bike and when tucked back, it bangs up again the spokes of my daughter’s wheel. EXTREMELY UNSAFE.
customer_reviews.author: wagopolus

customer_reviews.title: Best sturdy stand
customer_reviews.text: Best sturdy stand for the money. Much better than others that are even three times the price. Perfect sizing. Easy to put down and up.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael A.

customer_reviews.title: Too tight screw
customer_reviews.text: This was easily installed except the screw that needs to be loosened to adjust the length of the kickstand was IMPOSSIBLE to take out. We never did get it out and it ended up completely stripped and we even tried using pliers to grip it but it was impossible. Ordered a replacement. Let's hope this screw isn't put in nearly as tight!
customer_reviews.author: Sara C

customer_reviews.title: Not the bolt pictured
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand I received did not come with the hex bolt shown in the picture. It is round, and requires a large allen wrench (not supplied) to install. I will have to go to home depot and purchase the the correct wrench, since a standard set does not include one big enough for this bolt.
customer_reviews.author: SKB

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly good quality, sturdy item for the price I paid! Attached it to my son's bike in minutes. Now he no longer needs to drop his bike to the ground when he gets off. Fully adjustable to fit different size bikes. The only drawback is that the attachment point on his bike is just in front of the rear wheel, and the bike's center of gravity is further to the front, so it is not the most stable support. That is not the fault of the product though.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Just what the kids needed. Ordered two for my younger kids bikes. They kept throwing the bikes on the ground, so we purchased these to keep the bikes upright. They are very easy to install and have held up.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Luna

customer_reviews.title: Works for several sizes..would benefit from a larger foot
customer_reviews.text: We use this for my son’s 18 “ bike & just transitioned it to a 24” bike...durable & easy to install yet would benefit from a larger foot as you need to ensure the bike is well balanced so it doesn’t fall over.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy for child to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and perfect for my kid’s 16” bike. My child can easily kick it up and down to use. I love that it is adjustable so that I can still use it on my child’s next size up bike. Very sturdy too.
customer_reviews.author: F. Huang

customer_reviews.title: would be 5 stars if the black rubber tip didnt fall off.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this 5 stars. It installs easily and is pretty universal for different size bikes however the black rubber tip at the bottom of the kickstand already fell off. We ordered two of these and it only happened on one so perhaps it was a fluke but for safe keeping I'll remove and glue on the other one.
customer_reviews.author: ortizzle

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or frustration.
customer_reviews.text: So awful. Cannot get it to stay on my daughter bike no matter what we try. It’s been tightened so much that the metal in her bike is wearing away, but this thing STILL falls of. Biggest piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: MrsW

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, sturdy, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my granddaughters 18-inch bike! Very pleased. The expandable length will come in handy should they buy another bigger bike that comes without a kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.M.

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly on a Barbie brand bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Bikes with training wheels do not come with a kick stand. When my daughter outgrew the training wheels, I removed them. That’s when I learned that this bike didn’t have a kickstand. I bought this Bell Sport Bracer and it fits perfectly on my girl’s Barbie brand bicycle. I like the adjustable height of the kickstand. This way you don’t have to guess what size kickstand to order
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan K. Park

customer_reviews.title: Needed a drill to clean it up to make it work.
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't designed to fit my bike, so I had to get an old washer as a brace. And then I couldn't get the screw through the holes because the holes were drilled properly and had fraz leftover so I had to get a drill to finish drilling the holes. It'll probably work as a kickstand. It was just a small hassle to make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jake O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike stand at great price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sons 16” bike. It is adjustable for different bike heights. It works well. Only complaint is that there were no instructions so i had to look up online now to attach it. Otherwise it was super easy to use
customer_reviews.author: jwestie51

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand for adult bike
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a kickstand for her adult bike and we selected this one. We really like it--so easy to install and very sturdy. Well made and a value purchase too! Really pleased with this kickstand!
customer_reviews.author: M. Beverly Nash

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my daughter's bike needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent, so long as it fits your bike. Make sure this fits your bike. If it does, this is perfect. My daughter loves having a kick stand now like her big sister. Works perfectly and it's nice and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bellocchio

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 18 inch bike. The stand seems a bit off. The adjustment feature is nice, but i think his bike needs the spa between 2 of the holes. If a moderate breeze comes through, it'll knock his bike right over.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Stephens

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: the stand does the job, not a super strong one, but has plenty of backbone for a normal 26in bike. definitely well worth the money spent
customer_reviews.author: Binh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler son has recently transitioned away from training wheels, which held his bicycle upright when he wasn't on it. Unfortunately, the bike didn't come with a kick stand, and I couldn't find one for the bike until I came across this adjustable one. I read the reviews, and agree that you're gonna need a shot of lubricant on the pivot so a pre-schooler can use this kickstand, but I expect the same thing is true for any spring hinge of this sort. I'd recommend attaching this to the bike frame using a socket wrench rather than a pair of pliers because the bolt is flanged at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Salem

customer_reviews.title: Not a big fan of this kick stand. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of this kick stand. It does not 'kick' forward enough to make the bike stable. It is a bit on the short side but is adjustable. But, this does not over come that it simply does not sweep far enough in front of the bike to hold it securely. Any pressure or forces on the bike and it falls over. I can compare this a hand full of other kickstands and have never seen such a shortfall. Oh well, I was going to return but its too late now. We will have to make due. I do not believe this is a defect but a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: WSymionowZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my sons fat tire bike!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my sons fat tire bike. He has upgraded from training wheels to which the bike itself didn’t come with a stand. This fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great value and well made!
customer_reviews.text: Our sons bike did not have a kickstand so we ordered this one. Super easy to install and adjust the height to match the bike stance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bell Sports Bracer 100 Bicycle Kick Stand
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, and not damaged. It was easy to install on my kids bike, had it on in less than a minute. The adjustment screw was also easy to adjust. As this is on a kids bike, the sturdiness is not questioned. However, if you had to put this on an adult bike and extend it all the way out, I would question the reliability.
customer_reviews.author: randy21mTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is very sturdy and was as described. I put it on three different sized bikes for my kids. The stands are a bit hard for my kids to get down but that’s not due to poor quality. Great purchase. I’ll get another once my youngest gets a bike.
customer_reviews.author: R. S.

customer_reviews.title: Used on a Co pilot toddler trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Used on a Co pilot toddler trailer. Fantastic! Now I don't have to find a tree to lean the bike and trailer against. Needs fairly firm ground, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. The screw set would not loosen on either and is now stripped and is unable to be adjusted. I only kept one because it fit a 16 inch bike on the lowest setting. Buy greenfield or another brand as these are garbage
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P. Stenberg

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Sucks. This product is noisy when riding the bike and it holds the bike up but not very straight. Get what you pay for I guess
customer_reviews.author: EAJ

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these to put on a 16" and a 14" bike. It went on the 16" bike with no problems in a matter of minutes. The 14" bike was not really made to have a kickstand so I installed this on the back wheel stud. I had to take the bottom sleeve off to get it to work on the 14" bike as it was just a little too long but it works fine. They were a little hard to move to begin with, so I just applied some oil and moved it a few times, and the kids have no problem using these since.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price. Worked great for my daughter's bicycle. I would buy again in a heart beat
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for my girls’ bikes. One already broke and the other doesn’t work well. Reconsider getting these because quality isn’t great.
customer_reviews.author: meh

customer_reviews.title: Almost universal!
customer_reviews.text: I have a BMX bike that I am turning into a casual cruiser. It does not have a kickstand hole, but This fits perfectly being tightened onto the frame where it becomes triangulated. The adjustable aspect is better than I expected, it is VERY simple and easy. I definitely suggest this to everyone! UPDATE: Just bought my 2nd one, as I loved the 1st one I got. Unfortunately, it is A LOT tighter and I have to force it up and down more than I should. I greased it a bit, hope it helps more! Still more useful than the crappy stock ones I got!
customer_reviews.author: Ash Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 16” Specialized Riprock
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand was still too long, even at its shortest setting, for a Specialized Riprock 16” bike. It was easy to install at the center-mount hole, and easy to adjust, but just not short enough for this 16” bike. Specialized is definitely an industry leader, so maybe Bell should stop claiming this fits “most” bikes in the 12”-27” range.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable range kinda sucks, and so does the screw holding it in
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed some WD-40 on it to loosen up the sliding surface a bit, and now my kids have kick stands. Yay! Adjustable range kinda sucks, and so does the screw holding it in. Seems they should have through-drilled both bars and used a bolt rather than the flimsy screw, but... what do I expect for the price. It works, and I don't have to deal with my kids dropping their bikes on their sides anymore. :-D
customer_reviews.author: Varner House

customer_reviews.title: Barely worth $5.
customer_reviews.text: Jerry rig design. It will scratch your bike. It has barely enough clearance on a 16” kids bike. It will not work on anything smaller. Wobbly and barely functional in it’s designed purpose. If Amazon wasn’t kicking people off for returns, I’d send this back and buy something different.
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit on child's Frozen II bike.
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect fit for my daughter's Frozen II bike, which did not come with its own kickstand. I did apply a drop of Loctite Threadlocker Blue to the metal screws so that vibration wouldn't work them loose.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly on my 4.5 year old daughter's 16" huffy bike. Did not fit on my 2.5 year old daughter's weeride balance bike though (it might work if we drill a hole through the bike frame). We can still keep the extra one for my younger girl when she moves on to a 12" bike so it's not a problem. The kickstand was easy to install and works as a kickstand should. One star off because it's hard for my 4.5 year old to put up and down on her own, but we couldn't be happier to have the bike standing up instead of falling over all the time by just leaning it on a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Muna

customer_reviews.title: ahhhhhh
customer_reviews.text: good product, but not so sturdy, I ordered two of these and one could not stand bike up and peg is wobbly. seems to not have enough angle to it
customer_reviews.author: Kent Ishihara

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, both broke after a week or two of light (and proper) use. Bent at the part that attaches to bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ec42882

customer_reviews.title: Not so universal. Had to drill a new hole
customer_reviews.text: No so universal. I had to drill a new hole into the frame for this kickstand to be installed. The bolt required a 5/8" drill bit, which is pretty large and may not be in some homes. Once I got it installed, the angle on the kickstand is pretty wide and the bike leans way over to the side. But it does stand up on it's own, so it technically did the trick. I put this on a bike for a 5 yr old. I wouldn't use it on a nice bike. The adjustable length is a very nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Strong

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Quality metal, like it was made for my kids first bike. In shortest position, it stands but could use a little more lean for stability. But that’s being picky, great product
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler bikes that don't have one as OEM
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and keeps my 5 year old from just letting his bike crash to the ground when he parks it.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy & Barely Functional
customer_reviews.text: The connecting bracket is sturdy enough and easy to install. The stand itself consists of a flimsy tube with a flimsier, poorly fitting extension secured by only one set screw. Even at full length it does not quite extend far enough for an adult size bike, and bends a little as it takes the weight of the bike. I'm sure it's only a matter of time before someone leans on the bike and bends the stand beyond use. I think it would be sufficient for a very small child-size bike which did not require any extension, but this is not for larger or heavier bikes.
customer_reviews.author: SciFiFan

product_meta.title: Bell Sports Bracer 100 Bicycle Kick Stand
product_meta.description: Strong, all steel construction fits 12" to 26" bikes. Rust resistant with protective tip. Easy-to-install. No. 7015891: Bike Size: 12" to 26", Length: 10" to 13" Adjustable, Material: Steel, Pkg Qty: 1, Package Type: Card

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
